alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 5:32PM EST until January 02 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Meigs. In West Virginia, Calhoun, Doddridge, Gilmer, Harrison, Jackson, Lewis, Mason, Ritchie, Roane, Wirt and Wood. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM EST, County emergency management officials have reported several roads with high water throughout the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area by midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parkersburg, Clarksburg, Ripley, Spencer, Harrisville, Pomeroy, Elizabeth, Racine, Grantsville, Forked Run State Park, Ravenswood, Salem, New Haven, Pennsboro, Lumberport, West Union, North Bend State Park, Mineralwells, Sandyville and Jackson Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
